newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila Central Bank sells $70-80 mln - traders.
newsitem.headline: Manila Central Bank sells $70-80 mln - traders.

text.p: The Philippine Central Bank sold $70 million to $80 million at 26.375 pesos in late deals on Friday, traders said.
The Central Bank had to intervene aggressively again in the market because banks are betting it would further cut its overnight borrowing rate, they said.
On Thursday, the Central Bank trimmed its overnight borrowing rate by two percentage points to 18 percent.
The cut came a week after the Central Bank had raised the key rate by a total of 8.75 percentage points as the peso fell prey to the Asian currency turmoil caused by the Thai baht's problems.
